alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 11:51AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following counties, McCreary, Pulaski and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1150 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Alpine, Greenwood, Kidder and Delta. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
